title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHICAGO — The Chicago Bulls, fueled by the singular greatness of Michael Jordan, methodically dismantled the Detroit Pistons, 103-88, in a performance that served as another breathtaking chapter in his historic career.

Jordan was not merely the best player on the floor; he was a force of nature, pouring in a game-high 42 points. From the opening tip, he was uncontainable, slicing through the Detroit defense with a relentless assault. Every pivot, every fadeaway, was a testament to his supreme command of the game. The Pistons, known for their physical brand of basketball, had no answer for his offensive onslaught.

While Scottie Pippen provided crucial all-around support with 16 points, 12 rebounds, and 8 assists, and Luc Longley anchored the middle with 16 points, this night belonged to His Airness. The contest was a tale of two halves: a competitive battle early, with the Bulls clinging to a narrow 49-46 lead at the break. But in the third quarter, Jordan took over, extending the lead and snuffing out any hope of a Pistons rally.

Detroit was led by Grant Hill's 23 points and 10 rebounds, but their efforts were ultimately drowned out by the Jordan-led torrent. As the final buzzer sounded, the scoreboard told the story of a comprehensive team victory. But the lasting memory, the defining narrative of this night at the United Center, was the 42-point masterpiece from Number 23, another legendary entry in a career defined by them. The Bulls’ path forward, as always, ran directly through their incomparable leader.
